conclusion: To solve this problem, we need to analyze the given p-V diagram of an ideal gas undergoing two adiabatic and two isochoric processes. The diagram shows the pressure P versus volume V for two cycles: one adiabatic process from a to c and another adiabatic process from a to d.
In an adiabatic process, no heat is exchanged with the surroundings, so the internal energy of the gas remains constant.
